rootCause: Malware, suspected to be 'DTrack', infected an administrative network computer connected to the internet.
impact: Data exfiltration from an administrative network. Officials claimed the critical plant control systems were isolated and unaffected.
description: India's largest nuclear power plant, KKNPP, confirmed a malware attack on its administrative network. While the plant's operational controls were reportedly secure, the incident raised serious concerns about the cybersecurity of India's critical nuclear infrastructure.

sources.title: Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant's unit 1 and 2 not affected by cyber attack: Govt

rootCause: A misconfigured web application firewall (WAF) allowed a former AWS employee to access and exfiltrate data from Capital One's cloud storage.
impact: Compromise of personal information, including credit card applications and social security numbers, for over 100 million customers in the US and Canada.
description: A former Amazon Web Services engineer exploited a misconfigured firewall to gain access to Capital One's cloud environment. The breach was a significant example of a cloud-based data breach caused by misconfiguration, leading to the arrest of the perpetrator.

rootCause: Advanced phishing campaign targeting employees, leading to a breach of the company's network.
impact: Wipro's systems were used as a launchpad to attack at least a dozen of its clients. Attackers created a covert command-and-control infrastructure.
description: Indian IT giant Wipro was breached by a sophisticated threat actor who then used Wipro's network to launch attacks against its customers. The incident highlighted the significant risk of supply chain attacks where a trusted IT provider becomes the vector for compromising its clients.

sources.title: IT Giant Wipro Hacked, Used to Launch Attacks on a Dozen Customers
